content: AUTHORIZATIONS OF APPROPRIATIONS FOR UNITED STATES CUSTOMS SERVICE AND IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE. Authorized appropriations for the United States Customs Service to enhance border investigative resources, anticorruption efforts, combat drug smuggling and money-laundering, process cargo, and reduce traffic waiting times at certain ports on the Southwest and Northern borders. Authorized appropriations for the United States Customs Service include specific amounts for fiscal years 1999 and 2000, with additional funding as needed in subsequent years. This is to enhance enforcement and inspection resources on the Southwest land border, as well as investigative resources for anticorruption, drug smuggling, and money-laundering efforts. Authorized appropriations are allocated to enhance enforcement and inspection resources on the Southwest land border of the United States, combat corruption, drug smuggling, and money-laundering activities, process cargo efficiently, reduce traffic waiting times, and ensure all primary lanes are open during peak hours at major land border ports of entry on the Southwest and Northern borders. Authorized appropriations are allocated for salaries, expenses, and equipment for the Immigration and Naturalization Service to enhance enforcement and inspection resources on the Southwest and Northern land borders of the United States.
